Reviews.Title: “Its OK!!”
Reviews.Author: diya03
Reviews.Content: The room request for a twin and we got a double. The attendent declined to help the first night, but this was rectified from the 2nd night. The breakfast was just 3 cereals and toast, nothing special. maybe this needs to be included in the brochure. the location was good and easy to get to the conference centre.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: LHealan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April with my kids and my parents. The rooms were small, the beds uncomfortable and the breakfast was very disappointing. The location was great, but there are a number of other hotels/B&Bs in the area. We chose this hotel because they had 4-person family rooms that would my husband and I with our kids, and the price was right. In hindsight, I wish we would have spent a little bit more money and stayed someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “I will be back”
Reviews.Author: Ligia7808
Reviews.Content: Excellent location !!! Only minutes walk to the Victoria Station and the underground. Definitely a good choice for city trips. And easily walkable distance to Buckingham palace and beautiful St .James's and Green Parks. The area around the hotel was safe and nice, and there were nice shops and coffee houses nearby. Very kind and friendly staff !!! Good service and good continental breakfast !!! Overall an excellent value for money choice I would choose it again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “One Look Says It All”
Reviews.Author: Fla2UKTraveler
Reviews.Content: The day before my scheduled arrival at the NEH, London, the receptionist called to tell me to tell me that my information was not taken correctly and that it was my fault and that they had cancelled my reservation! That was my first indication that this hotel would be a let-down. She then proceeded to tell me that I would have to make a new reservation, at a higher cost than what was previously quoted. Since it was the day before our arrival, and we had other family staying there, we had no choice. We made the reservation again, amid tisks and sighs from this cheeky woman. I should have told her to forget it. It was an old place they had not bothered to keep up. The looks on the guests' faces at breakfast said it all. Not a single happy customer in the room. Masking tape on the carpet, no help with our bags, tiny showers, shabby shabby shabby. And rudeness on top of everything else. The most money I've paid for the smallest return, I wish we'd never stayed, but our cousins had made the res and we wanted to be close to them. The whole experience was, in a word, horrendous.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE. WORST PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: flemmer1
Reviews.Content: We were gone for a month traveling Scotland, England, and this is the worst place we stayed in a month of B&B'S. The staff were not freindly, it seemed like they hated their jobs. The breakfast was really bad, just toast for hot food, I looked in the kitchen and saw the guy wiping the cups with out water to clean them. The room was very dirty. We stayed 3 nights and in that 3 nights they never vacumned our carpets once. The blankets on the bed were stained and had hair all over them. DO NOT STAY HERE YOU WILL BE SORRY.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Chearful”
Reviews.Author: Nothern_soul
Reviews.Content: I was in London recently for the night and having left the hotel accommodation until the last minute had no choice but to book this hotel due to its close proximity to Victoria and it being one of the cheapest options. I did have a read of the reviews before and was quite apprehensive, but as I didn't have many other options I went ahead and booked the hotel. I thoroughly enjoyed my short stay here and would definitely recommend it for people looking for decent accommodation with a decent price tag. I originally booked a single room, but upon arrival was given an upgrade to a triple room. The staff were very friendly and helped with all my queries. The rooms, although not spotlessly clean were good and the toilet/showers were clean. All in all in was a good experience and would quite happily rebook in the future. Having read the comment below, what I would recommend is that if you want a top quality hotel experience then book the Dorchester!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, helpful and friendly staff, great location. Would return.”
Reviews.Author: Ithacaduck
Reviews.Content: We found the New England Hotel after seeking a booking at another hotel in the neighborhood and finding it full. We found the New England Hotel to be a lovely, older facility with cozy ensuite rooms and a morning cold breakfast service that was good. Its location in Pimlico made it convenient for walkers exploring London, and being quite near Victoria Station made it handy for tube, bus, and train travel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever stayed in!!”
Reviews.Author: kbsaks
Reviews.Content: We are not new to traveling in Europe, so we expected small and worn accommodations at this budget hotel. But this place was disgusting! Mold around the shower in the bathroom, mildew on the shower curtain, fingerprint smudges on the wall, stains on the sheets and blankets, and a layer of grime on everything. They use old grocery bags as garbage can liners and our garbage can still had marijuana ashes from the previous guest that made the room smell. The stairway had duct tape holding the carpet together, and the "breakfast" is coffee, juice and toast. While the location was good and the staff was very nice, there are tons of hotels in this neighborhood that had to be cleaner and better. Beware of the good reviews of this hotel, after staying here it's pretty obvious that they are planted by the staff. I am posting pictures as proof this review is real! We wish we had seen all these reviews before we stayed here or we really would have stayed somewhere else. We got this from a recommendation in a Rick Steve's book, but I will also be emailing him my thoughts and pictures and ask him to remove this hotel from his recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “This is the worst hotel I've ever stayed at, period.”
Reviews.Author: LillyAnn7
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel was its location, convenient to Victoria Station. Our room was tiny, filthy and the beds so soft I got a terrible back ache. I will say the bathroom had been recently redone so the tiles were clean, but the shower curtain had mildew half-way up it. The sheets and towels seemed clean, but the blankets and bedspreads were visibly stained. The carpet was stained beyond belief. I am embarrassed to say that it was so awful I did not even complain. I just did not want to deal with it. We just left early in the morning, stayed out all day and came back in time to sleep. Th good news is we did lots of sightseeing! I would not recommend this hotel unless the park bench is your only option, and maybe not even then.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: MikeCastling
Reviews.Content: Website looked OK. Didn't have high expectations for the price, even talked with the owner on the phone before booking, but reality was VERY different than what was intimated. The hotel was rundown, more like what I expect a youth hostel to be like. We were required to leave a 20 pound deposit for the room key! The hotel is tiny, worn out, not maintained. Rooms were beyond small, smaller than our cabin on our last river cruise, and the batheroom was too small to turn around in. No soap or shampoo supplied, noisy, dirty. The picture of their breakfast area on website looks spare but pleasant. It was anything but pleasant. Surly staff, reminded me of prison cafeterias in the movies. Absolutely terrible hotel, worst I've ever experienced in 30+ years of travel. Stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for a London B & B”
Reviews.Author: Josiem
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend break. Less than 10 mins walk from Victoria coach station, and about 40mins walk to Westminster and London Eye with plenty of resturants less than 15 mins walk away. The rooms are fine,comfy beds with reading lights, tv, somewhere to hang clothes and a dressing table.Tea /coffee making if you ask for a tray. Very good information book. Clean shower room with towels changed every 2 days. What more do you need? The staff are helpful and the simple breakfast kept us going till lunch. The carpet on the stairs is quite worn, but with 100 stairs and 5 floors (there's a lift) I would think it would cost a fortune to replace. We booked direct with the hotel and it was cheaper than going through a booking site. If we had another weekend in London we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy room with cockroaches and torn linen.”
Reviews.Author: Utsa
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights. Killed cockroaches . Curtains and blanket filthy. Quilt cover torn. Pillows like rocks.. Lift stops did not align with each floor level. Staff unhappy. 2 night penalty to find alternative. Unfortunately nothing else available. Breakfast meagre. Only plus is good location. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great service and Great location”
Reviews.Author: k1900
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located close to the victoria station. From there you can take the tube, the bus or the train. The neighborhood is pretty quit and contains a lot of restaurants. Its also close to some main attractions. The staff of the hotel was nice and very helpful. The hotel and the rooms were clean. Our stay in this hotel was good.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: overtoom
Reviews.Content: Our stay in the New England was a pleasant one. the people were very helpfull and friendly. we stayed in a family room ,which was ok, it was clean and nice . location was exellent

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE IF YOU WANT CLEAN.....IT WAS DISGUSTING!”
Reviews.Author: SusieQ061
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed in such a dump in my life. My money for my stay was taken in full, as soon as I checked in, wonder why? The room had no wardrobe and the tele was tiny and the sound didn't work. This was minor compared to the room. The walls were covered in black marks and something had been splashed up them, god knows what!! The bedspread was torn and had stains all over it, there was a blanket on the bed also stained....what hotels use blankets these days! Dust traps. The pillows were uncomfortable. I stripped off the bedspread and blanket every night and slept with just the sheets because at least these were laundered by a service. The curtains were filthy from the floor to about 10" up, and I mean BLACK! the rest of the curtains were dirty. It cost me Â£85 a night plus tax and this was a total rip off. I don't know how they get away with it. This hotel is about a 1* if that. I would advise anyone to steer clear.

Reviews.Title: “Nice on the outside, filthy on the inside.”
Reviews.Author: lsopd
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel after a good review in Frommer's and looking at the hotel's website. It looks very nice outside but upon entering the hotel we noted a musty smell, and observed duct tape on the leading edges of the carpet covering the stairs. In our room we noted dried blood stains on a bed spread, and unknown stains on the carpet. The carpet was filthy, such that we did not take off our shoes. We checked out early, even though we had to forfeit part of our deposit equal to one night's stay. This place was very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T stay at the New England Hotel!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GatorLiz355
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 3 nights at this HORRIBLE hotel. It is DIRTY, DIRTY, DIRTY. There was visible dirt on the edges of the carpet and baseboards in our room. One morning I purposely left little bits of trash on the carpet and none were vaccumed or picked up. There were black scuff marks on the walls in our room and in the common areas as well as splatter marks and drips (of what I don't know) on the walls. Stair treads were very worn and in some places repaired w/ duct tape!!! We were given no soap, no bath mat, no hand towel. But we were required to pay for the entire stay when we checked in and then had to give 24 hr notice when we wanted to check out early. No decent hotel requires the entire amount to be paid for when you check in. That should have been a big red flag for me. The New England Hotel is NOT a 3 star hotel and is not listed w/ the hotels desk at Victoria Station. We paid 95 GBP plus a 5% surcharge per night...very close to $150 per night. This hotel is one of the worst ripoffs in London. If anyone writes recently that they stayed at this hotel and enjoyed it, they are being paid to write the review or it is the owners. DO NOT STAY AT THE NEW ENGLAND HOTEL!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good atmosphere, extremely helpful staff and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: PerSorensen
Reviews.Content: Although our stay co-incided with the London Marathon, we were offered a very nice Family room at usual rate - whilst others were over-charging by reasons of the Marathon. The room was very clean and served as a splendid base for tours in the city of London with the perfect location of only 5 minutes walk to Victoria Station. Staff was very enjoyable, accomodating and most helpful. Certainly a very good stay, which we should be happy to repeat. We should be more than happy to recommend The New England Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good. I recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Arantes
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Very kind and helping staff. Clean and cozy rooms. Very quiet. Will return. good access to transports.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, well-run, quiet, clean and good service”
Reviews.Author: darec
Reviews.Content: I had a very enjoyable stay at the New England hotel. Its in a great location and near Victoria Station as well as many sights in London. The staff were very courteous and helpful. The hotel has an elevator which is a plus if you have luggage or you are on the top floor. The room was great. It was quiet as it must have good insulation. I didnt hear the people next door. Not like some other hotels in that area. Comfortable bed and the best towels. The room and bathroom were clean. This hotel has obviously been renovated not to long ago. Breakfast staff were courteous. Although the rooms may be small, the quality of the rooms and bathroom were tops. And you had an electronic key which is a plus. I wouldnt hesistate to stay there again. Clean, well-managed, courteous staff, and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for what it is.”
Reviews.Author: GulliverValencia
Reviews.Content: I booked a triple room for myself, wife and teenage son at this 3-star hotel. I paid what I felt was a fair price for a 3-star hotel in a good area of London in August. When you arrive at the hotel it looks elegant from the outside but when you enter the reception area to check in you get a bit of a surprise. Where has all the space on the ground floor gone? My question was soon to be answered. They asked for payment at the check-in which also surprised me a bit and we were allocated our room which was located at street level in front of the small reception area. There are 3 rooms located on the ground floor opposite the reception desk. The triple room was really a small double room with 3 beds in it. There was no wardrobe simply because there was not enough space in the room to install one. So with three people and 3 suitcases we were cramped for space. The bathroom was also very small . Being at street level with traffic-lights outside our room, it was quite noisy at night with the window open in the warm August weather. On the second night we decided to close the window. Breakfast is served downstairs in the basement in a rather poky dining-room. There are far fewer tables than rooms so it was not surprising that we had to wait a few minutes to get a table. We only had breakfast there once because it's not worth bothering with. We found good places in Victoria to have a proper breakfast but of course you have effectively bumped up the price of your room. The problem with this hotel is that it simply isn't of 3-star category. It doesn't have any of the basic facilities you would expect of a 3-star hotel and the room and breakfast were well below the standard expected. The only aspect of this hotel which was 3-star level was the price.Finally, when we checked out, I had to ask for the receipt when in all 3-star hotels I have previously stayed at, this procedure was automatic.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly dissapointed, nice location but very dated”
Reviews.Author: heartsofoak1974
Reviews.Content: Room facilities are, at best, average.......rooms were very small and the decor very antiquated. Appreciate that this is London and would expefct less for our money, but this hotel is in dire need of modernisation. Breakfast poor also, very minimal choice, since when did people serve biscuits for breakfast???? Travelled as a young couple, will definately spend a bit extra and stay elsewhere next time I come to London. On the plus side, that staff were friendly and helpful, the close proximity to Victoria tube and coach is a bonus. In short, wouldn't recommend, would suggest you spend that little bit extra for a bit of comfort and choice. Adios!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Simon_A76
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel for 5 days in October 2008 and it was above my expectations. Everything was clean and tidy. Staff was friendly. Breakfast is good. Sure I've had better ones but this one was quite decent too. Just a bit too early for me :-) Room was a bit small with improvised wardrobe but still adequate. Location of this hotel is perfect tho; you can walk to most of the attractions (Hyde park, Buckingham palace, London Eye, St. James Park, Trafalgar Square, Kensington palace, Houses of parliament with Big Ben, Jubilee gardens...) and Victoria Station with great connections is 5 minute walk away. I'll definitely check with this hotel first when coming to London next time.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful”
Reviews.Author: princesslotus
Reviews.Content: I was on the same course and staying in this 'bowel of hell' at the same time as the previous reviewer whom I could not agree with more! Tea & toast, in my opinion, does not a continental breakfast make. In addition to the horror of unwrapped soap on the toilet another of our colleagues endured hairs on the blanket and as for health & safety, I stayed on the top floor, in the nose bleed section, only to find the fire door propped open and the fire exit taped off! Less than 10 yards down the same street is a great western hotel which was cleaner, safer, CHEAPER and had a bar!!!! Do yourselves a favour and check in there instead, do NOT be swayed the apparent 'quaintness' of the exterior, this hotel (well B&B without the B) is in a fabulous area but there are many more superior places to stay within that fabulous area!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price.”
Reviews.Author: bo1lermaker
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was reasonable and sufficient. We would stay there again. A. L. S.

Reviews.Title: “Assistance in Time of Need”
Reviews.Author: TnsTrvlr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at New England Hotel in London a few years ago. On July 16, 2008, we found ourselves stranded in Dover as we missed the ship on which we were sailing on a Baltic Sea cruise. After we got back to London, since we are not internet savvy, we prevailed on Jay ( the owner) at this hotel to help us out. Jay booked for us the cheapest flights to Copenhagen and guided us on how to get to the alternative airport (Stansted) that we had never used before. He did this while taking care of his current guests (one needing an extra pillow, another needing some directions, etc.). Because of his help, we were able to get to Copenhagen the very next morning and meet with the ship a day later. We are indebted to Jay for this kindness.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in London”
Reviews.Author: travellers2008_8
Reviews.Content: After being invited to the Buckingham Palace Garden Party . We needed a hotel in easy reach of the Palace and the New England Hotel was perfect. The staff were all very friendly and couldn't do enough for us from getting cabs to taking photographs when we were all dressed up. The rooms were modern, very clean and had every thing we needed for our stay especially the fan I think it may have just saved our lives in the 80 degrees of heat. We will definetly return and pass on the details of the hotel to our friends

Reviews.Title: “Laughing now but...”
Reviews.Author: clerk2
Reviews.Content: Their website is very misleading...3 star luxury? Kind of funny now though...my room was clean enough(main thing!) but super small...only one towel...no soap...the shelves are installed about 7 feet up the wall so have to jump if you want to put something on them. The best is the breakfast...there is a notice on each table "Dear guest, please present yourself to the serving hatch (12"x12" hole in the wall at chest height so you have to bend over and peer in) with your room no. and key (like someone is going to sneek in for this) and place your order from our menu"....which consists of a choice of orange juice...coffee..cornflakes...white toast...and that's all folks! You're told to help yourself to cereal and juice so actually it should be called the toast hatch. Will stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the new england hotel”
Reviews.Author: edwardkern
Reviews.Content: What a very pleasant surprise! My business partner and I happened upon the New England Hotel accidentaly (we were disappointed with the hotel in the neighborhood which we had booked on-line as well as the Hilton in Manchester). We have each traveled for decades to many destinations and the New England Hotel is definately one of our very favorites. The key is the people: the staff was extremely helpful, providing us with the best exchange rate for our U.S. dollars, helpful directions and reccomendations for dining in the neighborhood as well as holding rooms for us on our return later in the week. The rooms were pleasant, clean and well attended to. The breakfast was good and nicely served in pleasant surroundings. The location was perfect for us, being near Victoria Station with easy transportation to all destinations. Our business will take us to the U.K. many times in the future and we plan on making the very comfortable New England Hotel our regular London "home."

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: kumardhruva
Reviews.Content: Great location. 5 minutes walk from Victoria station. Staff is very helpful and its low price makes it a great place to stay. Would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Simply, the best one”
Reviews.Author: faqi
Reviews.Content: I had an oppertunity to stay in New england Hotel, London for a two weeks period. I compared it with many other accomodations in central London but found it simply "the best One" in all respects. thank you "Jay" and the team for an excellent hospetality . Fazal Qadir Qalbani, Pakistan.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: Miaunitza
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve stayed in New England hotel two years in a row 2006&7 during summers ( 7-8 nights in total ) . Very nice location â€“ close to main tourists attractions. A street with beautiful white Victorian houses stretches in front of the hotel . The small reception did not border me because it was just a passing way. In the first year I had to get used to the small size of the room but it was like home in the second. Being there for holidays it wasnâ€™t my purpose to spend much time inside so it fitted my needs. It was just I was looking for: nothing fancy but convenient. Clean sheets, clean bathroom, good breakfast and very warm personnel. In my opinion the personnel makes the difference. Very helpful and friendly Jay, Anjie and rest of the staff were trying to please everybody. I really appreciate all the efforts your were putting in for making my stay pleasant Definitely I will repeat this experience .

Reviews.Title: “DON'T GO THERE”
Reviews.Author: bjrWisconsin
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3-week trip which included a stay at the New England Hotel in London/near Victoria Station. I actually saw this hotel in a London Visitor guide which I had obtained and of course it sounded like I could afford it and it had amenities I needed; ex. elevator/en suite facilities. I booked through the hotel. Three nites cost me $387.00 which isn't all that bad, or was it??? It was a B&B and the lobby was small as most are; not a problem here; used to that. When I opened the door, I knew I was in trouble when the door hit the twin bed. Upon entering the room I set my suitcase on the bed as there was no other place to put it if I was to close the door. The bedding (blanket, coverlet were filthy. The curtains were at one time white sheer, but not were grey and opaque from the dirt. There was a tiny table and chair( which was so filthy I used plastic bags as a chair cover both seat and back) in the room with a TV on it; so therefore no place to put even my eyeglasses. I believe the room was once without a bathroom and they plunked one right in the middle of the room. The nicest part was the bathroom, toilet, sink and shower. However, I had to buy bleach to rid the tub of mold. The carpet was so badly stained and moth eaten that I used one of my two towels on the floor so as not to step on it. After spending two hours cleaning the place with bleach, disinfectant, I felt I could sleep in the room; after all it was only for 3 nites and I was gone mostly during the day. Well another lessoned learned.....gee, maid for a day on vacation.... Note, this hotel had no reviews, I just went by what I read in the tourist guide and on the website.. Big mistake. They did serve a simple breakfast.... I hope they maybe can clean up there act there, as it was a good location to the Victoria Line; but I don't think so.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly but average”
Reviews.Author: KookasBurra
Reviews.Content: Would have to say that the New England Hotel was very friendly, family run hotel but... on the good side, bathroom although small was clean, good hot water and water pressure. Basic hot breakfast which was fine. Good, friendly service. The down side, as others have stated, was the bedspreads were very shabby and need to be renewed. One older style blanket, very narrow and the sheets were equally narrow. A change in these three things would have made a difference. Location was central but we found Victoria to be very busy with the coach station, undergound and district lines., lots of smokers to avoid outside. Mosty we only needed the underground and our last stay was very close to Gloucester Rd and was fantastic. Would have stayed there again but the hotel was no more!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay. Safe, clean and close to Victoria Station.”
Reviews.Author: SpankyOntario
Reviews.Content: I found The New England Hotel to be easy to find. As a single woman traveller, I found walking to and from Victoria Station (a 5 min walk) to be very safe (day or night). The hotel was very clean and looked to be newly decorated yet managed to reserve that old "English" ambiance. Jay and his family were all very accomodating and very friendly. It was my home away from home. The single room was small, but it suited my purpose pefectly and most importantly, it was very clean and cost (69 pounds per night). I did tours out of Victoria Station daily, and found The New England Hotel to be in a very convenient location on a well lit street. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, as I would definitely stay there again myself. My only issue I had with the hotel is that they only serve the complimentary breakfast from 8-9 am, and all the tours require you to be at the bus station by 7:45 to catch the tours on time, therefore, I was not able to eat breakfast at the hotel. If they would have served from 7 - 9 am, I would have been able to save myself an extra 10 pounds each morning. That is my only negative issue with the hotel. Thank you Jay and staff for making my first visit abroad and my first time travelling alone, a very satisfying experience. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Simple B&B hotel, still good value and location on repeat visit”
Reviews.Author: Gorey_Wexford
Reviews.Content: I posted a favourable review back in Oct 2006 and have no reason to change. The 4-star rating means 'above average' for the price. Where else could you get bed and cooked breakfast for 70 quid? I booked through their own Globekeys reservation service. They provide WiFi at a charge but as a repeat customer they waived the small charge for me. The clean, small, and comfortable room has TV and ensuite shower. No air conditioning, no tea maker in the room, reception closes at 11pm, if you need 3 star service move up to a real hotel and pay Â£100 or more. It's in an area behind Victoria station with hundreds of B&B and small hotels. Good hotels are hard to find at that price so having found one I came back to it. I recommend you print a Google map or the one on the hotel's website as Victoria Station has local maps on the walls but baffingly none say 'you are here' so you've no idea what direction you're facing until you go out and look around. Walking to the historical attractions at Westminster you pass through living London neighbourhoods with tailors beside second hand comic shops, supermarkets, street markets, everything.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: bexcy
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at The New England Hotel for two nights and it cost Â£191. We were most disappointed upon our arrival. The 'hotel' is actually more like a guest house and can not possibly be a 3 star rating. The reception desk is very small and straight next to the entrance. Once we had checked in we used the lift to the top floor and were amazed at the size of the room - it was very small. The hotel website stated that the hotel had been redecorated. I am not sure when! The quilt cover was dirty (although the sheets and towels were clean) and the plug sockets / light switches and pullies were very dirty. The net curtains looked as though they had been up for 10 years plus. There was an iron but it was in the breakfast room. We took it upto our room struggled to iron as it was so cramped. The iron looked like a Tesco economy iron and leaked lots of water over my parner's shirt so he couldn't wear it that night. We have stayed in many hotels in London which were much better than this. I would try and get somewhere else! I must add that all of the staff were very pleasant but their politeness does not make up for the quality of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We compared several hotels and chose New England”
Reviews.Author: meloneer
Reviews.Content: We had been looking for a hotel to use in our regular (twice a year or so) trips to London. We spent a day looking around the Pimlico/Victoria area and found the New England to be the best value, location, and level of comfort. We have not been disappointed. The rooms are well-appointed, comfortable, clean, and attractive. The service is attentive. The location is outstanding, and for this combination of factors, the tariff is an exceptional value. On our most recent visit, accompanied by two nieces, we again found the hospitality to be just what we needed for our stay in London. Convenient to Victoria, well-managed, clean, and comfortable, we found it to be an excellent base for our tourism. In brief, we have no complaints, and have consistently recommended the New England Hotel to friends and co-workers. We will continue to make it our home in London.

Reviews.Title: “The New England checks several squares”
Reviews.Author: roblev
Reviews.Content: The hotel gets mixed reviews on-line and my family has mixed reviews on it as well. But, I am the one who liked it because I was going for that local appeal. I didn't want a Marriott. It had a room for 4 (although very tight, rare find), it was secure, quiet, neighborhood has the London environment I wanted the kids to experience, walk to little cafes, a large grocery store is on the walk from Victoria (for inexpensive water supplies in July with no AC or ice in the country), Jay tries hard to please at the desk, the breakfast staff works hard, etc., we got good advice and no issues. This is not an American style hotel. I paid twice as much for an accidental zero star hotel in Lucerne that was just as small for 4. We dragged our luggage from Victoria and had a little trouble finding which direction to leave Victoria Station- it was more of a distance that I thought, but OK to walk once you know your directions. And, if you want to see WICKED, which is a trip highlight, this is the area to stay. There are at least 10 hotels along the walk to Victoria similar to the New England. We stayed at The George Hotel in Crawley for a small town feel and that hotel was older, more worn, and dirtier. The day we arrived we were able to walk most of the London sites - although very, very, long walks - enjoyable and close enough to make the walks. Expect small rooms, smaller hallways, a small elevator, older interiors, a nice breakfast room with fresh eggs and toast, and people who will chat with you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: williedillo
Reviews.Content: We booked a discounted room through an online travel site and were given a small, but clean room on the top floor. Fortunately, the hotel has a lift. Bed was comfortable, and shower pressure and temperature were adequate. Staff were very helpful and fixed problems like being short on towels quickly. Breakfast choices are limited (egg, bacon and toast or cornflakes and toast), but this seems to one of a few hotels in its class in London that still offers hot breakfast with the room price. Also, breakfast hours are limited: 8 to 9 AM, not good if you have early activities planned. Location of the hotel is a plus--on a quiet street of Georgian townhouses but close to busier streets with an interesting variety of moderately priced (for London) restaurants. I wouldn't pay the full rack rate for this hotel, but if you can get a discount through an online agency or by calling the hotel, it's a decent value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: donnalovescheese
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 1 night. Our main criteria for choosing a hotel in London were less than Â£100, close to a tube station and in a decent location. This hotel ticked all of the boxes. The hotel is a 5-10 minute walk from Victoria down a quiet side street. We were given a warm welcome and the staff were friendly and helpful throughout. The hotel itself was fairly basic. It was in need of redecoration (stair carpets had been taped up and paint work was badly marked) but the hotel felt clean and comfortable. Breakfast was a choice of cereal and toast or eggs, bacon and toast. I don't really understand previous reviews that complain about this as it was simple and tasty and similar to what I'm sure most people would have at home. In summary, the hotel was a basic small hotel and I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ok, wouldn't return!”
Reviews.Author: lolabunny
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from monday 9 july till wednesday 11 july. i had read the reviews on the website and was hoping that the hotel would be as expected, but no it wasn't! we arrived to be greeted by a rather unhappy man on reception. he told us what room we were in and we had to pay then, we could pay on departure, i thought this was very strange. we then asked for a kettle for the room but told no could not have one we have to pay them one pound per a cup of tea or coffee! the room was ok it was clean but not the cleanist it could have been. hotel in perfect location for the shows we went to see at appollo and victoria palace theatre. went down for breakfast and to be honest theirs no point in going down for it! we asked for toast and cereal but we only got the toast wich was two rounds of bread and one sachet of butter.there not over generous! the orange juice was ok but the coffee was vile! on the seconf morning we went to the cafe nerro round the corner as we didn't see the point in staying for a shocking and cheap breakfast. if you have the bacon and egg just bear in mind you get one rasher of bacon and one egg, thats it!! the staff were very unhappy and rude and didn't want to help you much at all. we then asked for a teaspoon as i have medicene which has to be mixed with a spoon, he wasn't going to give us without a fight! the to top things of on the morning of departure you have to vacate your room by 10am it was 9.30 and the cleaners barged in our room and getting ready to clan it.overall hotel was terrible and i would never return here again. Location is good for the appollo and victoria palace theatre.

Reviews.Title: “Small but OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: EuropeVAC07
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the New England Hotel after looking through Trip Advisor reviews. This hotel wasn't our first choice but the other choices were already booked. Our experience was good, not wonderful, especially considering with the US to UK exchange rate we paid a lot for an average room. The room was very small, but also very clean. To conserve water, the shower was mearly a trickle of water, slightly annoying. Breakfast was my biggest gripe. Buying an English breakfast in London costs about $20 for two people, so eating breakfast at the hotel is smart (if you're on a budget). We were informed that breakfast is only served from 8:00 to 9:00 in the morning. Unfortunately many days we wanted to leave the hotel at or before 8:00 to see all of the wonderful London sights. This meant we only ate breakfast at the hotel 2 out of the 5 nights we stayed. I felt that the staff could have been more accomodating to it's guests and at least offer a cold breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good neighborhood, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: trevh47
Reviews.Content: Spent June 11-14 at the New England. We were really happy with the location - 10 minute walk from Victoria Station and the neighborhood was safe and had plenty to offer. Our room was on the third floor in a corner location facing the street - suprisingly no issues with street noise, and being it was our first "European" hotel room we had no issues with it's size. The breakfast was fine for getting us fueled for the day, and we found Angie and the staff to be helpful and pleasant. The next time we are in London we will make our home base the New England Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoJane
Reviews.Content: My husband and I reserved a room for 7 nights at the Hotel New England in London after reading very favorable on-line reviews of this hotel. We liked the location, near Victoria Station, and the fact that the hotel was non smoking. We anticipated a small, attractive and clean hotel, with buffet breakfast. We found the hotel quite attractive on the outside but cramped and dirty on the inside. The carpets were in terrible shape, dirty and worn and stained, the beds were mediocre, the bedspreads were stained, and there was not a buffet breakfast, only toast and a choice of a fried egg with bacon or cornflakes, served in a small basement breakfast room. The cost was 89 pounds on a weekend night and 95 pounds during the week. The unpleasantness of the hotel negatively affected our impression of London, so after two days we decided to change hotels. We advised the hotel that we would be checking out the next day. The hotel penalized us for insufficient notice and charged us for one night that we did not stay in the hotel. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice London Hotel, Good Price!”
Reviews.Author: zippyincolumbus
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, I felt like I had a pretty good handle on what to expect at the New England Hotel, and it was all very accurate. The staff is very friendly and helpful, especially Angie. She helped us decide what to do our first night there, recommending Picadilly Circus/Leicester Square to us, and it was good advice! We had a great time. The room was a little on the small size, but expected with a London hotel, especially in this price range. Four of us (two couples) stayed for 4 nights in a family room with 2 double beds for â‚¤140 per night. It was a little bit of a squeeze, but very manageable. The hotel is very clean and the staff is very willing to give you fresh towels and things when you ask for them. Our window opened and we had a fan we could use, although the weather was a little on the cooler side and we didn't need it. The breakfast was just what we needed to get going in the morning- nothing heavy, but simple and delicious. We had our choice of cornflakes and toast or bacon, eggs and toast with juice and tea or coffee. As everyone has said, the location is fantasic. There are quite a few restaurants, shops and grocery stores nearby, and the Victoria train/tube station is only a 5-10 minute walk. We used the tube quite a bit with our Travelcards (highly recommended, by the way- the Travelcard- if you are spending any time in London at all) from Victoria, and it was the perfect location to be in. Overall, we were all very satisfied with our stay here. We felt safe at all times and enjoyed this hotel as our London base.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: zuluwarriors1879
Reviews.Content: I needed to book a family room for my sister, my elderly dad and my young daughter. Booking a reservation through email was very easy and the replies to all my queries were very efficiently dealt with. The hotel is security wise, not a problem. The entrance door is controlled from the reception counter and the hotel is monitored using CCTV. The room door used an electronic lock and the door is very secure. The room though simply furnished was in good order. The housekeeping was no problem at all. The staff, Jay and his sister Anjie are excellent. I found them very helpful and warm. They have been in the business for a long time and their advice always useful. The location of the hotel is very convenient; near the Victoria Underground and the Victoria Coach Station. Due to the location, travelling around Central London was not a problem for a first timer like me. I had no difficulties catching a cab near the hotel or directing them to the hotel. Coming from a very safe Singapore, I did not at any time feel unsafe in the surroundings of the hotel. There were many eateries nearby. I also did not have any difficulty obtaining groceries and other miscellaneous items from the nearby shops. Given that the hotel was suitable for an elderly man and a young girl of 5, I am sure families will not have a problem if they chose a room at New England.

Reviews.Title: “A fine establishment!”
Reviews.Author: George70
Reviews.Content: Everything was very nice at the New England Hotel. We heartily recommend the hotel to anyone who asks. Nice, clean, well kept, secure rooms at a reasonable London price. The elevator is a great plus, for those of us getting on in years multiple flights of stairs can be painful! Jay and Anjie are friendly helpful hosts. We really liked the location as well, and we so enjoyed the dinners we had just a couple of blocks down the street. The New Jomuna Indian restaurant and the Cyprus Turkish restaurant were very good and so convenient. Great memories.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant welcome, clean, warm and pretty breakfast room.”
Reviews.Author: smartstuff
Reviews.Content: I recommend this little hotel, just 5mins walking distance to Victoria Coach and Train stn. Perfect for business trips - the hotel is clean (sounds obvious but...), warm, safe and practical. Family run B&B hotel, where owners are polite and welcoming. Oh! And reasonably priced!H,Nov.06.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat customer.”
Reviews.Author: naej
Reviews.Content: As an mature female traveller who sometime needs "affordable" accomodation in central London between ventures I find this hotel meets all my needs. The location is good and safe even very early in the morning and late at night. The "complimentary" light breakfast offers a good start to the day. Dead easy walk to Victoria trains, tube and coach station. Many quaint little cafes and shops and even market stalls in surrounding streets. And of course not forgetting a large Sainsbury"s just around the corner. There is also another smaller Sainsburys within Victoria Station complex. Remember we are talking central London, so even if the rooms are small the price is good for what you are getting and where else would you get a free breakfast thrown in for goodness sake.

Reviews.Title: “A clean place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: mym
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a ten minutes walk from the underground and buses at Victoria Station. We had two rooms (one twin and one tripple) that were small but clean. The beds were comfortable but the pillows a little too hard and the blankets didn't look too clean. The breakfast was insufficient but quite okay. We would have liked a buffet, even though it's nice to be served. Since our stay was in November we had no problems with hot summer nights and our room had two mirrors (including the one in the bathroom). Overall we think that the New England Hotel is a good budget (?) alternative if you're looking for a clean place to sleep in the expensive city of London.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cath357
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel for trying to find something affordable in London for the budget traveller. They had a hot breakfast which was okay, and its a good safe location near Victoria station. Rooms were small but nicely decorated and clean. Angie and Jay at the desk were really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Totally overpriced, and its not even that expensive!!”
Reviews.Author: perrierjouet
Reviews.Content: We knew this was not going to be the most luxorious of hotels judging from the price and the photos we had seen. But this hotel really is not worth the price! There are other hotels in London that are the same price and are leagues better! If the New England were charging Â£65 a night I could not complain but I have got to know other hotels in London, in a similar location that are so much better. The plus side were the fluffy white towels, although these are not changed every day...we did ask for more and were provided with them straight away. There are no tea making facilities but again, we asked and the staff were polite, providing us with a kettle and 2 mugs. Carpets felt grubby and our room was tiny, hardly enough room to get around the beds. Breakfasts are really poor, just cornflakes or a cooked breaky which was average, no fruit or anything else. we didnt even bother on the second morning. You will be disappointed, its cheap (ish) but trust me, you'll find better!

Reviews.Title: “Good location; helpful owners/staff”
Reviews.Author: LSC06
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the New England Hotel for three days. It was our first trip to London. We were given a very pleasant greeting upon arrival and lots of local information and advice. Angela and Jay were always helpful as we departed and came back to our room each day. The room was very small, but I understand that this is common in London. It was clean, the TV worked well, and we had everything we needed. The simple breakfast also provided a good start to the day. The hotel has an excellent electronic key system and a lift to serve the higher floors. We found the location to be great for arrival and departure at Victoria Station, and for exploring London.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good”
Reviews.Author: CMRD
Reviews.Content: Great Location, only 10 mins from Victoria. We stayed here in August, and there was no Air Con- Very warm but we had fans supplied. The Bathroom was tiny, with a towel covering some kind of pipes near the floor- disgusting! Place needed a good hoover- very dusty. There was no mirrors at all in the bedroom, so after a shower you had to wait for the mirrors to de-mistfy- not grt when 3 girls are sharing!! Arriving back after a hard days shopping it wasn't great to find a black bag of rubbish ( from all the other bedrooms) in the middle of our room. We also noticed we had got 2 clean towels between the three of us. One of which we had to ask to be changed because it was dirty. When we asked at reception for sufficient towels, we got the reply; " Oh, you want clean towels every morning?'- considering it was August, and we were taking at least 2 showers a day.....!?!?!?! Check out is at 10am- which sucks. Our phone rang at 10.05am- telling us to check out. When we left at 10.20am , the whole family- (Granny, Granddad, etc!!!) was standing outside our room- staring at us, big time. Would not recommend this place, nor would I ever stay here again!! R.S.D. - Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Jay and Anjie Extraordinaire”
Reviews.Author: ktdeasy
Reviews.Content: Jay and Anjie were so helpful while we were in London staying in this family owned B&B. We stayed here a week and they were always polite and helpful with travel advice, money exchange, and directions. The rooms were comfortable and clean. Location was great and close to grocery, Victoria Station and Coach station. Only wish breakfast was earlier as we started our day before it was served at 8:00-9:00. Would recommend to anyone staying in London and will return next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Central to Everything”
Reviews.Author: CarolP99
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance of most of the major attractions. Victoria Station with its central line and District line offer direct access to those you canâ€™t walk to. The staff is friendly and helpful. The beds and bath are very clean. The only drawback (itâ€™s a tradeoff for the great location) is the traffic noise from the street â€“ itâ€™s a very busy area. If you are used to street noise a first floor room will be fine, if you prefer a bit more quiet ask for a room higher up or on the Warwick Way side.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: WaltzingDot
Reviews.Content: On our way home from Madeira, we stayed three nights in February at the New England Hotel. We chose it because the prices were reasonable and it was close to Victoria Station and the Gatwick Express. We were glad we did. We especially enjoyed the good service and friendly staff. We will make it a point to stay there again when we are in London.

Reviews.Title: “one night visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the New England Hotel with my teenage daughter for a theatre trip visit.We were very pleased with the room. It was very pleasantly decorated and clean and the beds were comfortable. The reception staff were most helpful.

Reviews.Title: “My London Home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The New England is a first class hotel with friendly and helful staff. The rooms are superbly clean and the food excelent. After three visits I never stay anywhere else when in London. Keep up the good work all at my London Home.

Reviews.Title: “Looking for a great place to stay in London?!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: June 8, 2006 My wife and I have just returned from a 16 day stay at the New England Hotel, located at 20 Saint George's Drive, Victoria, London SW1V 4BN. The Location of this hotel is within easy walking distance of Victoria Station, espcially for travellers using Gatwick airport as our point of entry. Added to this, the room was priced well within our budget which included breakfast, and ensuite facilities, and very comfortable. The owners, Jay and Family were warm, welcoming and helpful. The establishment was clean, safe and secure. This is a facility that I will stay at again, whenever my travel plans include London as a point of destination. I have recommended this Hotel to several of my fellow employee at my office since my return. One of them is planning to visit London with his family this summer 2006. Date of my arrival: Wednesday May 17, 2006 Date of my Departure: Friday June 2, 2006 This might not be "The Ritz", but you get value for your money!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We couldn't ask for a more friendly place. the front desk was great,and the behind the scenes staff made it feelmore like a home than a hotel. Loved it and would come back without a second thought

Reviews.Title: “Our Whole Family Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family, including my mother, brother, husband, and teenage daughters, all agree that we will be staying at the New England Hotel the next time we get to London. The staff is great. They made us feel like family while we were there. The rooms are clean and the location is very convenient. We even enjoyed making the reservations!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff / Good Accommodation & Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall, our stay has been very enjoyable. The staff was always gracious and helpful. Besides the dated furnishings, the hotel is very clean and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Treated us like family”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for the better part of a week and had a wonderful experience. We were warmly greeted and made to feel at home every time the staff saw us. The location is perfect for seeing the sights of London. We look forward to another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the New England on a weekend. We thought the room was comfortable and the staff was very nice. They were certainly trying hard to please. The hotel is fairly close to Victoria station and buses which made it convenient. The morning breakfast was good, as well. It is only from 8 to 9 though so there isn't much room for fooling around. Thanks to Divina and Jay.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we came from scotland to stay in london to celabrate my husbands brithday and take in a show. the hotel and its staff only added to our enjoyment and made it an enjoyable weekend i found the hotel to be very acessable, you could acess all areas of london from this location the staff were very friendly and went out of their way to help you it was easter weekend when we stayed and even though the hotel was busy you felt that due to the service you recieved you were the only guest there. Breakfast was excellent and well presented i would certainly stay there again without hestiation when ever i am back in london

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very nice and helpful people inside, rooms are small but clean and welcoming, also it is in a very convenient location to start visiting London, highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “highly regarded”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall rating above average Definitely exceptional in response level to all requirements/requests. Pleasantly surprised at the hotel's size; very clean, friendly and helpful staff Overall review Pleasantly surprised after receiving such a poor recpetion at Hanover Hotel where I refused to stay on Health & Safety grounds as floor had collapsed and contractors were still working on repairs yet they were still accepting bookings! St george's Drive is a very convenient location within walking distance of the Victoria Station, usefully placed to get to lots of places for work and leisure yet quiet at night. Service above level expected in a small establishment. Caring and responsive attitude to guests. Room - very pleasant. Bathroom well equipped. shower worked well. Water hot. Hair dryer to hand. Couldnt find tea/coffee things which would have been useful. Value - as a single guest prices don't compare with value. Cleanliness - very good in every way Breakfast - requests dealt with cheerfully Ratings Room Above average; Service Above average; Value average; Cleanliness above average; Dining above average

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Place New England Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the New England Hotel was a very pleasant experience. Both the location and price point for London were good. The hotel staff was very helpful with any questions and requests we asked of them. The rooms were neat and clean and it was nice to have the elevator at the end of a long day of walking to see all the sights. We would recommend a stay with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the New England Hotel for the second time. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean, but sometimes a bit small. Anyway, good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Locatin, Location”
Reviews.Author: go4broke
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent choice for a budget category hotel especially if flying into Gatwick. No tube travel is necessary to arrive at the hotel, which is a big deal if you have to juggle luggage and crowded tube conditions. The hotel room and bath are very very clean, and the beds were really comfortable. You can set up tours from the front desk upon arrival, the process was very easy, and the tour was excellent. As a first time visitor to London, I felt very comfortable in the surrounding area. You are very near underground, train , and bus connections. Many major sites are within 2 tube stops or a brief walk.

Reviews.Title: “a grat hotel”
Reviews.Author: ranaldik
Reviews.Content: this is a good hotel,it's very clean and confortable. if i return in london i woul like to stay in thi hotel again. the staff is friendly

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good Find”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Besides the cleanliness, location and value, the staff makes or breaks a hotel. The New England was just right for us. Jay & his staff made us feel welcome from the start. The rooms are neat and clean, small but typical of London size rooms. The elevator is great, especially after a busy day of touring. Excellent location, near lots of sights and Victoria Station. Breakfast is simple but adequate. Many places to shop and eat nearby. We booked on-line from the US, very easy to do business with the New England, would repeat if coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Looking for a good value?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We found the New England to be a good value for a modestly priced hotel in London. Within walking distance of Victoria Station, it issituated in a nice, quiet neighborhood; cabs were also extremely accessible. Just down the street, we found a nice little family restauraunt where we ate several times and also a corner store for junk food.The staff was friendly and most accomodating. The rooms are not spacious but the beds were comfortable. If you want a clean, affordable place to stay and can accept function over fancy, the New England is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For someone who detests London Hotels, The New England was a welcome change from the normal corporate blandness experienced at some of the big chain hotels. It's excellent central location and friendly owners keep me coming back.

HotelInfo.Name: New England Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 20 St. George's Drive | Victoria, London SW1V 4BN, England
